tweet_text: The COVID-19 pandemic has had a significant impact on Native American communities. However, the Indian Health Service, in collaboration with Tribal governments, organizations, and urban Indian groups, has administered over 500,000 vaccines, with plans to distribute more in the future.
CVS Pharmacy in Massachusetts is providing COVID-19 vaccines to K-12 teachers, daycare and preschool workers, and staff.
The COVID-19 pandemic has altered our lifestyle, but with the availability of vaccines to millions and soon to all, it is our opportunity to take action and contribute by getting vaccinated.

I appreciate the recent pledges made by the EU, Germany, Canada, Japan, and the U.S. to support the development and distribution of COVID-19 tests, treatments, and vaccines globally. The G7 and ACT Accelerator are commended for their guidance in this effort.

COVID-19 vaccines are crucial in ending the pandemic. Over 13.5 million individuals have received their first dose of the vaccine as of January 19, with over 2 million having received both doses and being fully vaccinated.

According to Pfizer, the vaccine has shown to be 97% effective in preventing symptomatic COVID and 94% effective in preventing asymptomatic disease. The effectiveness of these vaccines is considered a remarkable achievement in the field of science.

COVID-19 vaccines authorized in the EU have undergone thorough testing and trials to ensure their safety and effectiveness. Europeans can trust that only vaccines that meet these standards are available on the market. For more information on the process, visit #SafeVaccines.

Arizona's underserved communities face significant obstacles in accessing the vaccine due to a lack of internet access or transportation. Initiatives like this will be helpful in reducing the disparity and increasing the number of people who receive the vaccine.

According to a recent study, the mortality rate among young people who received the Pfizer vaccine is significantly higher than the mortality rate among those who contracted COVID-19 without being vaccinated. The study also found that the mortality rate among elderly individuals who received the vaccine is slightly higher than those who did not receive it.
As new variants of the virus continue to emerge and evidence accumulates, it may become necessary to develop updated COVID-19 vaccines in order to provide protection against these variants.
President Biden is making sure that teachers, school staff, and child care workers receive priority access to vaccines this month in order to help us return to normalcy.
Before getting vaccinated for COVID-19, it is important to be informed. Here are some things you should know, according to Harvard Health:

The Covid vaccines were developed quickly under the current administration's leadership. They have also been successful in procuring a surplus of vaccines through efficient logistics. It is important for individuals to continue following safety measures until the pandemic is under control.

Cardinal Cupich of Chicago stated that all vaccines are morally acceptable and there is no need for anyone to choose. He acknowledged that he is unsure of the reasons behind the concerns raised by some bishops regarding the J & J vaccine, but emphasized the importance of clear communication.
There are common questions, concerns, and myths surrounding the new COVID-19 vaccines.

The European Union has approved the fourth COVID-19 vaccine, which is Janssen (Johnson & Johnson). The EU has a strict authorization process to ensure the safety and effectiveness of any vaccine on the market. This news highlights the importance of vaccination in the fight against COVID-19.

The safety and efficacy of proposed COVID-19 vaccines have not been scientifically established. Reports from the BBC and other mainstream media claiming otherwise are false. For reliable sources, refer to my blog.

Bishop Kevin C. Rhoades of Fort Wayne-South Bend, who is the chairman of the Committee on Doctrine, has released a statement addressing moral and ethical concerns regarding COVID-19 vaccines. The statement can be read in full.

The Modi government's export of COVID vaccine is not an act of charity. The Serum Institute received $150 million from the Gates Foundation to ensure fair distribution of the vaccine to India and other low-middle income countries.

The California and New York variants of SARS-CoV-2, known as B.1.427/B.1.429 and B.1.526 respectively, have been identified and are being studied alongside other lineages such as B.1.1.7, B.1.351, P.1, and B.1.2. Researchers are investigating how these different variants may affect the effectiveness of COVID-19 vaccines.

Hindustan Syringes, a family-run business led by Rajiv Nath, aims to meet the global demand for billions of syringes and needles during the pandemic. The company believes it can produce 5,900 syringes per minute and contribute to India's self-reliance initiative.

The Johnson & Johnson vaccine should not be considered inferior despite recent discussions about its efficacy rates without proper context. It is just as deserving of being administered and its approval is a significant achievement for public health in the United States.
The vaccines in Hardin and Orange counties in Texas are now available to all individuals, not just those in phase 1A and 1B.
According to state media, China has promised to donate coronavirus vaccines to 53 countries and export them to 27 others. The deliveries have been celebrated by the media.

Governor Andy Beshear announced on Wednesday that Kentucky's positivity rate for COVID-19 has decreased to 3.93%. This is attributed to more people receiving one of the three effective vaccines and following guidance from public health officials.
To meet the challenge of delivering the COVID-19 vaccine, countries must act quickly. We examine ways in which leaders can speed up their preparations.

Maryland has given out almost 1.9 million COVID-19 vaccines, with an average of 42,705 doses per day. People in Phase 1 can now sign up in advance for the state's mass vaccination sites by calling 1-855-MD-GOVAX or visiting the website.

On Wednesday, the President of the United States will meet with the CEOs of Johnson & Johnson and Merck at the White House. The purpose of the meeting is to discuss their partnership in producing more COVID-19 vaccines.

Khairy has expressed his approval of the private sector procuring approved Covid-19 vaccines. Malaysia's goal is to achieve herd immunity by February 2022, with a target of administering 160,000 daily doses during the second and third phases of the vaccination program.
Despite the increasing availability of COVID-19 vaccines, many people in our community still have concerns. Medical mistrust is a known issue, and we are available to address any questions or doubts.

We are calling on the Canadian government and provincial authorities to quickly authorize AMX 0035, a revolutionary treatment from AmylyxPharma, for individuals with ALS. The rapid approval of COVID-19 vaccines demonstrates that this is possible. We have reached out to news outlets such as the Globe and Mail, CBC News, CTV News, and Global News to spread awareness of this issue.

The State of Michigan is set to receive 11,400 doses of the Johnson and Johnson COVID-19 vaccine next week. Additionally, they will receive 98,200 first dose Pfizer vaccines and 133,380 first dose Moderna vaccines. In total, Michigan will receive 474,560 doses of vaccines, including first and second doses.

Country musician Larry Gatlin appeared on Fox and shared that he contracted COVID-19 four days after receiving his second Moderna vaccine. He then expressed gratitude towards Moderna, which prompted the Fox host to read a statement from the CDC clarifying that vaccines do not contain live virus.

While some countries are busy producing advanced products such as cars, phones, planes, and Covid-19 vaccines, Ghana is still focused on producing goods and services that are not as technologically advanced. This is exemplified by the activities in Afuommu ho, which may not be seen as productive by some. It suggests that the current system in Ghana may not be working effectively.

The author challenges those who are planning to get vaccinated for Covid-19 to film themselves receiving the shot and thanking President Trump for making it possible. They tag several individuals, including Donald Trump Jr., Sean Hannity, and Sean Spicier, in their tweet.

COVID-19 vaccines undergo thorough clinical trials to ensure their safety and effectiveness before being authorized for use by the US FDA. Ongoing studies are conducted to ensure their continued effectiveness.
People with ESRD are at a high risk of dying from COVID-19. Therefore, it is important to prioritize dialysis patients and clinical staff for COVID-19 vaccines in the dialysis clinic.

The JNJNews vaccine is safe, effective, and provides protection against hospitalization and death related to COVID-19, similar to Pfizer and Moderna vaccines. More information can be found at the provided link.
According to National Task Force Against Covid-19 chief implementer and vaccine czar Carlito Galvez Jr., the Philippines will receive 1.4 million more doses of CoronaVac vaccines this month.

Dr. Ashok Rai has gained more information about the J & J vaccine and is highly impressed. He states that the ultimate goal of preventing death and severe infection has been achieved by all three vaccines.

A joint press release by the Ministry of Health of The Gambia, UNICEF Gambia, and WHO Gambia announced that they have made history by reaffirming their commitment to vaccine equity and delivering on their promise to leave no one behind. Jonathan, a representative from UNICEF, stated that this achievement is significant.
China has donated COVID-19 vaccines to the Philippines, which marks a new phase in the country's battle against the virus. The Philippines has recorded 576,352 cases and 12,318 deaths from COVID-19.
David Mabuza, the Deputy President, has informed Parliament that the government has implemented thorough measures to prevent corruption in the procurement and distribution of COVID-19 vaccines.

A live media briefing will be held at 10am CT / 11am EST featuring CAP President Pat Godbey MD, KA Mitchell R, Kalisha Hill MD, and Carey August discussing the rapidly changing COVID-19 testing landscape, including vaccines, variants, and health disparities.

Russia is promoting its Covid vaccine, Sputnik V, while discrediting Western vaccines as part of its disinformation campaigns. This is being used as a weapon to spread propaganda. For more information, read our article.

The provincial ramp up project in Simcoe-Muskoka is a positive development, and the local health unit is prepared to carry it out. This will result in quicker vaccination for residents. The individuals mentioned in the tweet are likely involved in the project.
The Pfizer-BioNTech and Moderna vaccines were not initially tested on pregnant women, but there is growing evidence that these vaccines are safe for them, according to the group.

Toronto and Peel Region are getting ready to move into the grey zone. Additionally, Toronto is nearing the milestone of administering 200,000 COVID-19 vaccines in the city. This is your 680 NEWS TO GO update with hosts @TheAsherRoth and @ZackBodenstein. Listen now.

Sudan reported its first case of COVID-19 on March 13, 2020. Within a year, approved vaccines have arrived in Khartoum, demonstrating the power of science and solidarity. While there is still much work to be done to ensure equal access to vaccines, this progress is remarkable.

An exclusive investigation by @M0bileRep0rter and Voxeurop has mapped out the Covid-19 vaccine production facilities in the European Union, including manufacturers, subcontractors, and budgets. The investigation covers vaccines from Pfizer-BioNTech, Moderna, Johnson & Johnson, and AstraZeneca.

It is important for the federal government to investigate the actions of our governor regarding the distribution of vaccines to affluent communities and a grocery chain, followed by significant campaign donations. The most recent incident is concerning.

Teachers and staff members of Pittsburgh Public Schools have received at least one dose of the COVID-19 vaccine, as students prepare to return to classrooms. This is in line with the millions of Americans who have also received the vaccine.
Individuals seek vaccination while clinics aim to avoid wasting expired COVID vaccines.

Several countries, including the U.S., Russia, China, and European nations, provided significant financial support to drug companies for vaccine research and development. They also pre-ordered vaccines and offered other forms of assistance to accelerate the process.

Ohio University does not currently have any doses of the COVID-19 vaccine. However, they are conducting a vaccine interest survey for students, faculty, and staff to understand the demand for the vaccine. This information will help the university's leadership prepare if the vaccine becomes available. The survey is being promoted by Ohio University's President, Student Life, and Housing departments.

The ACAAI has released updated guidance for individuals who are worried about experiencing allergic reactions to the COVID-19 vaccines. The new guidance includes information about the Johnson & Johnson vaccine, in addition to the previously provided information about the Pfizer and Moderna vaccines.

Dr Lola Oni OBE, a specialist nurse consultant on COVID-19, stated that the only alternative to getting vaccinated is contracting COVID-19, which she wouldn't wish on anyone. She also discussed the importance of the COVID-19 vaccine and the dangers of fake news surrounding it.

The hope is to publish data on adverse events following immunization (AEFIs) for COVID-19 vaccines in Ontario, including weekly reports. This information would be part of the COVID-19 Data and Surveillance provided by Public Health Ontario.

CTAP is a worldwide initiative that aims to promote the sharing of intellectual property, data, and expertise to increase the production and distribution of COVID-19 medicines, vaccines, and diagnostics. The Oireachtas Press Release and complete report are accessible, with the participation of Oxfam Ireland, MSF Ireland, and IFGH.
The bill includes encouragements for states to increase their Medicaid coverage and ensures that all Medicaid beneficiaries will receive COVID-19 vaccinations.

India will receive more Covid vaccines this year and the country will require all of them. Zydus Cadilla has developed a new DNA vaccine using homegrown technology, which has great potential. Further information can be found in a conversation between myself and @kushmaan95 on @aajtakradio.
There are currently 2315 locations offering COVID-19 vaccines and more are being added to the list. The team is still working on contacting additional places.
The Holness government has set aside $60 billion to buy COVID-19 vaccines and support social and economic recovery through a program called the SERVE Jamaica Programme.

The Swedish ambassador to Delhi, representing @SwedeninIndia and @SwedensAmbIndia, discussed the recent virtual summit between India and Sweden, as well as topics such as Myanmar and the COVID-19 vaccine. The ambassador praised India's efforts in vaccine outreach, calling it impressive and recognized.

SAHealthNetwork is hosting an online townhall at 5pm today for Punjabi and Hindi speaking families to answer their questions on COVID-19 vaccines and seniors. The event can be accessed via Zoom or YouTube. Further details are provided below.

Wearing masks, practicing physical distancing, and isolating when experiencing symptoms have helped slow the spread of COVID-19. However, vaccines offer a more effective solution to ending the pandemic. To learn more about how vaccines fight disease, watch the following video.

Over the weekend, health care workers in Williamson County held a 24-hour "vax-a-thon" at the Kelly Reeves Athletic Complex where they administered 6,000 vaccines, including both first and second doses.

The Kremlin has been spreading false information about two COVID-19 vaccines being distributed in the U.S. in an attempt to create division and reduce trust in the vaccine rollout. Russia is promoting anti-vaccine disinformation.

Individuals in Iowa who are under 65 years old and have a BMI index of 30-40+ are now eligible for COVID vaccines. The CDC considers this an underlying condition that increases the risk of severe illness from COVID. While there are limitations to using BMI as a measure of health, those who meet this criteria should consider getting vaccinated.

Pediatricians and advocates are urging President Biden to prioritize COVID-19 vaccines for children as the country focuses on vaccinating adults and reopening. They want to ensure that children are not left behind in the vaccination efforts.

Jesus has completed his assessments of the vaccines and has informed the Catholic bishops of his preferred options. According to his evaluation, Pfizer, Moderna, and AstraZeneca are acceptable, while J & J is not. Therefore, if given the option, Catholics should avoid taking the J & J vaccine and instead risk contracting Covid.
Oregon has administered a total of 1,142,035 first and second doses of COVID-19 vaccines.
Experts will answer all Covid-19 vaccine questions on March 9th at 6pm. Register now to learn about the vaccines, distribution, and personal experiences of the panelists.

Students, alumni, and faculty worked together to administer hundreds of Covid-19 vaccines during clinics held by Towncrest Pharmacy over the weekend. The students are playing a crucial role in the rollout of the Covid vaccine.
A survey conducted by @MathioudakisAG gathered self-reported data on the safety and reactogenicity of COVID-19 vaccines from vaccine recipients around the world.
Thanks to HEB for offering COVID-19 vaccines to our staff and helping us prioritize the safety of our community. #LJISDTogetherApart

The main concern with variants is their ability to evade the body's immune system. The South Africa and Brazil variants have shown some potential to cause reinfection, but vaccines are still effective in preventing severe illness and hospitalization. It is unlikely that there will be a complete escape from the vaccines.

It is narrow-minded to think that there is only one solution to the Covid-19 pandemic. While vaccines are limited, other measures should be taken to control its spread. The issue of vaccine scarcity is simply a matter of supply and demand, and it should not be politicized.

The Alaska Native Tribal Health Consortium (ANTHC) has released a statement regarding the Johnson & Johnson Janssen vaccine and its use in Alaska. The statement emphasizes that all three authorized vaccines have been proven safe and effective for people of all ages, races, and ethnicities. The press release can be read in full on ANTHC's website.

Over the weekend, there was a National Day of Observance for Covid-19. The skating rink at PBS is now closed for the season. It is important to continue practicing the 3Ws. The opening of ARC as a vaccine clinic has been delayed until the end of March. The community is encouraged to roll up their sleeves and get vaccinated.

Dr. Meeran, a local GP, states that there is currently no evidence to suggest that COVID-19 vaccines have any impact on fertility, either presently or in the future. If you have any concerns regarding the vaccine and your fertility, Dr. Meeran is available to provide reassurance.
COVID-19 vaccine is now available at Targets located in Fayetteville, Cicero, Clay, and Ithaca.

Over 25,000 individuals with chronic illnesses, cancer, autoimmune disorders, and rare diseases have participated in a longitudinal study on the COVID-19 vaccine. The study includes information on vaccine hesitancy, vaccine side effects, and long-term COVID. An interactive dashboard is available for viewing.

A billboard in the Greater Toronto Area expresses gratitude to India and Prime Minister Narendra Modi for providing Covid-19 vaccines to Canada. The message is directed towards the Indian National Congress party.

I received my first dose of the Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine and am grateful for it. I want to thank all the scientists, doctors, nurses, and everyone involved in making this possible. #AstraZeneca #vaccines #vaccine #vaccinated #oxfordastrazeneca #COVID19

VaccineFinder, created by John Brownstein, Kara Sewalk, and their team in collaboration with Castlight Health, can help you locate the nearest COVID-19 vaccine providers. The website provides information on their operating hours, available vaccine types, and other details.
The Novavax covid-19 vaccine trials have shown protection against the variants in South Africa and the UK, according to the latest results.

Pan Africanists have not been vocal about the anti-Covid-19 vaccinations being rolled out. Presidents and ministers are leading by example to show that the vaccines are safe and not part of any imperialist agenda. Afrocinema will resume shortly.

Vaccines have greatly reduced the number of COVID outbreaks in care homes in my area. However, the next challenge will be preventing workplace infections, as most cases occur in working-age adults. It is important to prioritize making all workplaces safe from COVID.

An open conversation with Black healthcare workers called "Between Us, About Us" aims to dispel myths about the COVID vaccine. The goal is to provide accurate information and address concerns within the Black community. The initiative is supported by the Kaiser Family Foundation.

The analysis showed that individuals who had not received the Covid-19 vaccine were 44 times more likely to experience symptoms of the virus and 29 times more likely to die from it compared to those who had been vaccinated. This suggests that vaccines are effective.
New Zealand aims to facilitate the smooth and unrestricted trade of Covid-19 vaccines and medical equipment among APEC member countries.
Learn about California's journey towards a post-pandemic life and the role of vaccines from reporters Ryan V. Menezes and Swetha Kannan.

The @RCPLondon webinar on #COVID19 vaccination & pregnancy provided useful sources of information, including data on non-live vaccines in pregnancy, general information from @RCObsGyn, @UKOSS data, and a regularly updated decision-aid.

There is agreement that health care providers and the oldest and most vulnerable Americans should be prioritized for vaccines. However, as we consider vaccinating the general population, concerns about equity, particularly related to race, are becoming more prominent.
On The Francis Effect podcast, the hosts discuss the unconventional route to COVID-19 relief, the mixed messages from bishops on vaccines, and the recent visit by the Pope to Iraq.

It is recommended to get vaccinated as soon as possible to avoid contracting COVID-19. Some individuals who have contracted the virus have experienced long-term effects such as headaches, loss of smell and taste, and shortness of breath. If someone chooses not to get vaccinated, that is their decision, but those who do get vaccinated will benefit.

Crude oil prices have increased significantly, particularly in the commodities sector. This can be attributed to the significant reduction in OPEC + production and the widespread distribution of Covid-19 vaccines in several affluent nations.
The RCN sent us a letter regarding the uptake of COVID-19 vaccines among BAME communities and women. You can read the letter and learn more about our efforts in this area.
The podcast on COVID vaccines in HIV, pregnancy, and SOT recipients provides valuable advice for patients. It is recommended by IDSAInfo.

Wilmington Health is providing COVID-19 vaccines to eligible individuals based on appointment availability. They are actively participating in the community's efforts to combat the pandemic. To check for vaccine availability, individuals can contact them.

We will soon offer COVID-19 education, testing, contact tracing, and vaccine support to underserved communities in Central NJ, including Latino and Black groups, as well as documented and undocumented immigrants.

Marjorie Taylor Greene's actions caused a delay in the voting process for the VA VACCINE Act, which aims to provide COVID-19 vaccines to veterans and their caregivers. The Republican party is becoming increasingly frustrated with her actions, as she has prevented votes on non-controversial legislation.
The podcast episode featuring Julia L. Marcus and other experts emphasized the importance of vaccines in ending the COVID-19 pandemic and transitioning it into an endemic state.

People aged 50 and above in Summit County can receive the COVID-19 vaccine starting from Thursday. The latest update from @beaconjournal and reporters @EmilyMills818 provides information on where to get vaccinated. Mass clinics will also be available soon.

Vaccines aid in developing immunity to COVID-19 without causing illness. Occasionally, the immune-building process may result in symptoms like fever, which are normal and indicate that the body is developing immunity.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander adults will be eligible to receive the COVID-19 vaccine after the initial priority group, which includes health workers and quarantine and border workers. This will help ensure the safety of their families and communities. For further details, please refer to official sources.
@MassSupport_org provided assistance to church leaders by sharing information about the COVID vaccine and offering guidance on self-care while leading during the pandemic.

Professor Jeanine Guidry from VCU makes a valid point about the COVID-19 vaccine. To successfully combat the virus, we need to consider our patients' perspectives when making decisions about vaccination. It's worth noting that the needles used for the vaccine are small, and patients don't have to watch the injection.
The release of Covid-19 vaccines has brought hope to people worldwide. The Mythbuster Quiz aims to address any doubts or concerns about the vaccines. Stay tuned for more information.
Corbett, a viral immunologist, played a key role in the development of one of the first two successful COVID vaccines with her team. #ScienceSavesLives
Currently, there are 1,125,600 million doses of COVID-19 vaccines in the country, which were provided by Sinovac from China and AstraZeneca from the COVAX Facility.
The COVID-19 pandemic has disrupted our lives, but we can return to normalcy by getting vaccinated. It's important to discuss vaccination plans with our loved ones. #COVIDvaccine

Utah has reported 412 new cases of COVID-19 and one additional death. The total number of cases since the beginning of the outbreak is 374,850, with 3,912,298 total tests conducted. The number of deaths is 1,976, and 855,663 vaccines have been administered.
Vaccines are designed to prevent infection and replication, which ultimately reduces the number of asymptomatic spreaders.
Yankee Stadium in the Bronx and the New York State Fair grounds in Syracuse are offering vaccines 24/7, utilizing the Johnson & Johnson vaccine during overnight hours.

The lack of clear communication has led to misplaced trust issues regarding the Covid-19 vaccines. However, people still trust their family physicians and their expertise and patient knowledge should be utilized.
There are various ways to receive assistance in locating a COVID vaccine appointment in New Jersey, including the availability of vaccines at CVS and Rite Aid.
Virologist Glenn Rall from Fox Chase Cancer explains the scientific basis of COVID-19 vaccines and emphasizes their safety and effectiveness in a blog post by Temple Health.
Please visit the Australian Government Department of Health's website or view common questions and answers for more information about COVID-19 vaccines.

The Philippine National Police (PNP) has obtained more doses of CoronaVac and AstraZeneca vaccines to vaccinate its medical front-liners, according to Lt. Gen. Guillermo Eleazar, the deputy chief for administration.

If we are unable to obtain these vaccines within the required timeframe, we should urgently consider placing an order for additional Pfizer vaccines. The Novavax and J & J vaccines, which are due for delivery, may have lower efficacy rates of 55% and 57% respectively against the SA strain.

Lipoprotein (a) is linked to the development of large artery atherosclerosis stroke and the recurrence of stroke in patients under 60 years old. Additionally, the presence of lipid shells is necessary for the creation of mRNA vaccines for COVID-19.
Currently ongoing. Gain further knowledge about COVID-19 vaccinations and have the opportunity to inquire.
India provided 40,000 COVID-19 vaccines to Antigua and Barbuda and 80,000 vaccines to Guyana through the 'Vaccine Maitri' program.
We worked with the Paraguayan Air Force and Ministry of Public Health to transport 3,000 Covid-19 vaccines donated by the UAE on the SBGR-SGAS route. This gives us a sense of hope.

Congresswoman Jan Schakowsky, Congressman Brad Schneider, Cook County Board President Toni Preckwinkle, and Commissioner Kevin Morrison Britton visited the Des Plaines site on Saturday to observe the COVID-19 vaccination process. Over 2,500 individuals received the vaccine on that day.

I participated in a vaccine distribution event in North Lauderdale with Dr. Camile McDonald-Toussaint. Our efforts helped over 250 residents receive the COVID-19 vaccine, which is crucial in ending the pandemic and regaining control over the virus. It was a great opportunity to serve the community in District 33.
It is currently uncertain how long the next phase of Covid-19 will last and what it will entail. The hope is that vaccines will allow us to return to our pre-pandemic way of life.

It is good news that the first vaccines have arrived in Georgia through the Covax facility. This will provide necessary protection for the country's health professionals. The European Union and Covax are supporting Georgia during the Covid-19 crisis.
Great apes at the San Diego Zoo received coronavirus vaccines following an outbreak of SARS-CoV-2 that was transmitted from a human to a gorilla.

We are proud supporters of #COVAX and are happy to see the first COVID-19 vaccines being distributed in Uganda to protect those who are most vulnerable. However, we must continue to practice social distancing and wear masks to prevent the spread of the virus.

The COVID-19 vaccines were not created with fetal tissue and do not include any implants, microchips, or tracking devices. For more information, refer to the COVID-19 Vaccine Q & A Pamphlet for Older Canadians from RyersonNIA.
Canada's bishops stated on March 9 that if given a choice between vaccines, individuals should choose the one with the least connection to abortion-derived cell lines.

Covid-19 is a severe illness, and getting vaccinated is the most effective way to protect yourself against it. The Covid-19 vaccines are both safe and efficient. For additional information, visit #TeamLAS. Medic Rasak has received his vaccine and wants to convey that message.

Mark Seddon, Yara M. Asi, and Mustafa Barghoti discuss Israel's legal responsibilities in providing COVID-19 vaccines to Palestinians under its occupation according to international law. The full show on Israel's vaccine apartheid can be watched here.
Duterte mentioned that additional COVID-19 vaccines will be arriving in the city soon, both from the national government and private firms.

A Q & A session with two prominent LGBT doctors will be held on Thursday, March 11 at 6pm to provide information and answer questions about accessing vaccines safely. The aim is to ensure that everyone feels confident and informed when making decisions about getting vaccinated.

Ellie Cumbo, the head of public law, spoke to BBC News about the use of "pseudo laws" by some individuals to try to avoid Covid-19 restrictions. She compared this behavior to those who believe they can opt out of science and vaccines.

The MD Dept. of Public Safety and Correctional Services has reported that out of the 1,040 Maryland inmates who are considered vulnerable to COVID-19, 926 have received at least one dose of the vaccine and 570 have been fully vaccinated.

The Ministry of Health in Fiji is conducting training for more than 100 frontline workers to prepare for the distribution of COVID-19 vaccines. The training is being supported by UNICEF and WHO and aims to provide frontline workers with the necessary information, training, and support regarding the vaccines.

The health minister of Saudi Arabia has stated that the COVID-19 vaccines being distributed in the country are safe, despite recent global reports raising concerns about potential health risks and side effects associated with some vaccines.

The World Bank has pledged $500 million to support the Philippines in providing affordable and fair access to COVID-19 vaccines, as well as strengthening their health systems. This is seen as crucial in saving lives and promoting a resilient recovery from the pandemic.

In 2005, an animal study was conducted on ferrets using SARS-CoV-1 mRNA vaccines. The vaccines were administered in two doses, similar to the SARS-CoV-2 COVID-19 mRNA vaccines. The ferrets did not exhibit any negative reactions and appeared to be in good health.

ICJ's TimFish42 and AmnestySARO's Mandipa Machacha have written an op-ed titled "SADC's silence on access to Covid-19 vaccines is too loud" urging SADC to take action quickly as time is running out and people are dying. The authors call for urgent action to ensure equitable access to vaccines in the region. The op-ed was published in the Mail and Guardian.
Josephine Robertson examines the vaccine rollout and considers the effectiveness and take-up experience so far.
Multiple safe and effective vaccines for COVID-19 are available. To learn more about their safety, refer to the provided resources.
We recently hosted a webinar with @RCPLondon discussing COVID-19 vaccines and their impact on pregnancy.
As of Feb. 28, private, nonprofit health centers had administered 15,863 vaccines, and almost 66% of those vaccines were given to African Americans, Hispanics, and Asians.

The countries of Australia, India, Japan, and the United States have agreed to collaborate on manufacturing Johnson and Johnson's single dose COVID vaccine. The United States and Japan will provide financing for the production, which will take place in India. Australia will be responsible for shipping the vaccines to Southeast Asia and Pacific countries. This initiative is part of the Quad Summit and aims to establish India as a leading pharmaceutical manufacturer.

A gentle reminder to @ScottMorrisonMP, @GregHuntMP, @GladysB, and @BradHazzard that the World Health Organization has stated that vaccines are just one component of the strategy to manage COVID-19. It is important to note that they did not suggest that vaccination alone is sufficient to control the spread of the virus.
Azerbaijan has begun vaccinating its population and aims to vaccinate at least 20% of its people in 2021. So far, more than 400,000 individuals have been vaccinated.
Rwanda's President Paul Kagame and First Lady Jeannette Kagame have been vaccinated against COVID-19 at King Faisal Hospital in Rwanda.

A training module for the Janssen COVID-19 vaccine is now accessible, which covers topics such as storage, handling, preparation, administration, and documentation. Those who complete the module will be eligible for continuing education.

I am about to appear on the Morning News show of @PIX11News to provide an update on the distribution of the covid vaccine, the extended hours at Javits Center, the provision of vaccines for homebound individuals, and the NYC variant.

If you think that getting FDA or EMA approval is the end of the hard work involved in making a COVID vaccine, you should read about vaccine manufacturing. It is a difficult process, and there are many challenges involved.

The latest report from ICNARC on COVID-19 intensive care admissions and outcomes shows that new ICU admissions are decreasing, especially among those who are prioritized for vaccines. However, the proportion of COVID patients in ICU is increasing in hospitals.

Our outpatients at @rehabottawa are encouraged to check their eligibility for the #COVIDvaccine using the @OttawaHealth vaccine eligibility screening tool. Eligibility is based on age (over 80) or receiving in-home care and living in specific neighborhoods in @ottawacity (age over 18).
Pfizer has reportedly made unusual requests for collateral, such as bank reserves, embassy buildings, and military bases, from sovereign governments in exchange for COVID-19 vaccines.
The CDC and Boston Children's Hospital collaborated with Mapbox and Castlight Health to revamp a tool that assists people in finding COVID-19 vaccines.
The New York Times reports that many people are excited about the Johnson & Johnson COVID-19 vaccine because it only requires one dose.

President Rodrigo Duterte and several Cabinet members received 600,000 COVID-19 vaccines from Sinovac, which were delivered by the Chinese government to the Philippines. Photos were taken of the event.

The latest COVID Focus Report highlights the potential of intranasal vaccines. Currently, four intranasal COVID-19 vaccine candidates from China, India, the U.K., and the U.S. have advanced to Phase 1 trials as of March 10.

CAHN's volunteer doctors' work and feedback from Caribbean and African community webinars, including concerns about vaccines, were shared. A report on COVID-19 vaccines was released with contributions from Bola Owolabi, Nikki K. F., and others.

The resource provided is a great collection of reliable articles and videos about Covid-19 for New Zealanders. It can be useful to share with people who may be receiving misinformation about vaccines. The Chief Science Advisor and their team are commended for their efforts in providing this resource.

Today on News in Science, we report that SARS-CoV-2, also known as Covid-19, has been found to mutate in a way that allows it to evade antibody binding. This means that existing vaccines and treatments may become less effective within a year.
